large enough for storing & processing a largish number of packets
A receive thread has a pool of receive buffers,
large enough to contain several network packets and derived
Before requesting a packet from the kernel, a receive thread
from the buffer, which is the administrative
entity representing a raw packet along with additional
and a byte range within the packet at
which the serialized payload is stored.

containing various metadata on the sample is allocated. The
includes a reference to the receiver state as

, using interval tree pointed to by a
Completed samples that have been received out of order are
linked into chains of consecutive samples, with the sample
chains organized into an interval tree using
Once a sample has been delivered, the reference count of the
s pointed to by its fragchain are decremented, eventually
freeing the original network packets and recovering space in
